H0.text: In Shakespeare’s play what is the name of Hamlet’s mother. Ophelia

H1.text: In Shakespeare’s play what is the name of Hamlet’s mother. Lady Macbeth

H2.text: In Shakespeare’s play what is the name of Hamlet’s mother. Cordelia

H3.text: In Shakespeare’s play what is the name of Hamlet’s mother. Gertrud

A4.text: In William Shakespeare's play Hamlet, Gertrude is Hamlet's mother and Queen of Denmark.

A5.text: Her name may derive from Gertrude of Bavaria, who was Queen of Denmark in the late 12th century.

A6.text: It follows Gertrude from her wedding to King Hamlet

A7.text: The character of Gemma Teller Morrow on the FX show Sons of Anarchy, which incorporates plot elements from Hamlet, is influenced by and shares many traits with Queen Gertrude

A8.text: The play depicts Prince Hamlet and his attempts to exact revenge against his uncle, Claudius, who has murdered Hamlet's father in order to seize his throne and marry Hamlet's mother.

A9.text: Hamlet accuses her of immodesty and cries 'get thee to a nunnery'.

A10.text: He is also indirectly involved in the deaths of his love Ophelia (drowning) and of his mother Gertrude (mistakenly poisoned by Claudius).

A11.text: The play opens with Hamlet deeply depressed over the recent death of his father, King Hamlet, and his uncle Claudius' ascension to the throne and hasty marriage to Hamlet's mother Gertrude.

A12.text: By this account, Gertrude's worst crime is of pragmatically marrying her brother-in-law in order to avoid a power vacuum.
